timeline.message: Added support for WRITE tokens in CAPADD

timeline.bodyText: Why it does not override already present capabilities?
timeline.author: ftence

replies.bodyText: Because if you override you cannot selectively add capabilities from a given token, wherease by combining CAPADD with the current behavior and CAPDEL you can select which capabilities will be (artificially since you actually delete them first) overridden.
replies.author: hbs

timeline.bodyText: A WarpScriptException would be helpful here.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: I would find NULL CAPDEL to clear all capabilities to be less error-prone than [] CAPDEL: having an empty list could happen, having a NULL capability key is much less likely.
timeline.author: ftence

timeline.bodyText: top could also be null, Capabilities.get would behave the same.
timeline.author: ftence

replies.bodyText: Changed the behavior so only null returns the full set of capabilities, if a list is passed, only those in the list are.
replies.author: hbs

timeline.bodyText: You should also add a put method, currently in CAPADD to be consistent.
timeline.author: ftence
